page.title: 12Village Green Wimbish
page.content: This is known locally as the School Green (grid ref:0559202355).It has been used for play by the village children for over 100 years.The County Primary School,built in 1876,is on the North side,whilst the original village school,now St.Pauls Chapel,is near the West side of the green.In front of the school wall is the village pump.This was placed here a few feet from its original site 10 years ago.Next to the pump is a barn like structure called the Stable because the School Managers kept their horses in it when visiting the school before motor cars.Now the children use it for shelter in wet weather.On the South and East sides are a group of 7 trees(4 chestnut,3 flowering cherry)planted by the school children in National Tree Planting Year 1973 when the slogan was"Plant a tree in 73,plant some more in 74".
